pronunciation: DECE'ASE, [Latin to depart or to withdraw.]

definitions.text:
Decease
 Literally, departure; hence, departure from this life; death; applied human beings only.Moses and Elias, who appeared glory, and spoke of his decease which he should accomplish Jerusalem. Luke 9:31.DECE'ASE,
To from this life; die.Gen. Washington deceased, December 14, 1799, the 68th year of his age.
